title: Volunteering
text:
Tui-Tui bird conservation (SEOR, 2020 & 2021) ‚Ä¶ One of the rarest bird in the world the SEOR association is trying to save by spreading rat poison, traps, locating breeding couples and monitoring illegal hunting A video will be available soon!

Photos coming soon.

Beach clean up day (Best Run, 2021) ‚Ä¶ A clean up day at Cap La Houssaye in Reunion to raise awareness on coastal pollutions. Garabe were collected and weighted. We found washing machines, burnt scotters and heaps of household & food trash left by people

Photos coming soon.

Birds CMR (SEOR, 2021) ‚Ä¶ A session of bird capture for marking & recapture that took place in the East of Reunion Island by a sugar cane plant. This was also helping the SEOR association.

title: Jeremy A. Dubrulle
text:
Hi, I‚Äôm Jeremy.


Thanks for visiting my website fellow scientist ‚Äì Let‚Äôs dive together in the incredible world of (Bacterio)Phages! Here you‚Äôll find everything you want to know about me (I hope!) and about phages!

I‚Äôm a PhD student in the Fineran group at the University of Otago, Dunedin, New Zealand. I study plasmid-borne antibiotic resistance and phage defense systems in the context of Phage Therapy. I got into phages reading the Good Virus (Tom Ireland) and I‚Äôve stucked with them! How cool is it to study Lunar-Exploration-Module-looking like viruses everyday?
I‚Äôm a big fan of adventuring and exploring nature‚Äôs craziest evolution. I‚Äôm always on the hunt for some exploration & finding out what natures has to offer! When it comes to work, I love the lab! Give me a petri dish of bacteria, and I‚Äôll make millions (of phages, of course!).
Fun fact, I grew up on Reunion Island - you won‚Äôt hear that everyday! I bet you a post-doc contract that you can‚Äôt locate it on a map! Check it out: To Reunion Island blog

üìÑ View CV üéôÔ∏è View Talks history üìö View Publication Records
üíº Browse my Projects üëã Get to know me!
